explanation.text: The claim is an existential feasibility claim ('can be made') about a fiber battery architecture with twisted parallel anode and cathode wires. For such claims, demonstration of at least one working example is sufficient to support the claim.

Literature search revealed direct evidence of the claimed configuration: an arXiv source explicitly describes 'two electrode wires' (anode and cathode) that are twisted together after depositing an all-solid electrolyte/separator layer, forming a functional wire-shaped lithium-ion battery.

The architecture satisfies all three critical feasibility criteria: (1) Geometric feasibility - wires can be physically twisted in parallel configuration; (2) Electrochemical feasibility - separator/electrolyte layers prevent short-circuiting while enabling ionic conduction; (3) Functional feasibility - demonstrated working batteries using this exact architecture.

Additional literature confirms that fiber-shaped batteries maintain the same fundamental components as planar batteries (anode, cathode, separator/electrolyte) but reconfigured onto a fiber-shaped skeleton, validating the architectural approach.

The twisted parallel wire configuration with separator coating is an established architecture in flexible and wearable battery applications, with multiple published demonstrations including CNT/Si composite fiber anodes in wire-shaped lithium-ion batteries.

evidence_1.citation: A fiber battery can be made with an anode wire and a cathode wire in a parallel configuration with the anode and cathode wires twisted together.

evidence_2.citation: Twisted aligned carbon nanotube/silicon composite fiber anode for flexible wire-shaped lithium-ion battery.

evidence_3.citation: An all-solid LiPF6 composite layer functioning both as the electrolyte and battery separator is deposited onto the two electrode wires before twisting.

evidence_4.citation: The arXiv source explicitly describes electrode wires being twisted together with separator/electrolyte layers deposited beforehand... The literature confirms this EXACT configuration exists and functions.

evidence_5.citation: The principle is the same of the planar batteries, which are composed of anode, cathode, and electrolyte/separator. The difference and the pivotal part is to establish a fiber-shaped skeleton, on which the battery components are stacked.
